```{r}

library(haven)
library(sjmisc)
library(sjlabelled)
library(ggplot2)



table(IRS$country) #frequency of respondents per country ID (84 respondents for country "10")

table(attr(IRS$country, "labels")) #how to view frequency by name (the way it is in the codebook) instead of Variable name (country ID) 

attr(IRS$alcolmc, "labels") #to see value of each response. EX: 0= never last month , 9= no answer


IRS$alcolmc2 <- (IRS$alcolmc) 

IRS$alcolmc2[IRS$alcolmc2==7|IRS$alcolmc2==9] <- NA
table(IRS$alcolmc2, useNA="always")

meandrink <- mean(IRS$alcolmc2, na.rm= T) #mean of drinking frequency 


ggplot(data = IRS,aes(x= alcolmc))+
  geom_histogram(stat = "count", show.legend= TRUE, color= "black"
           , alpha = .8) #plotting responses by frequency 


TCM <- table(IRS$country,IRS$alcolmc)
barplot(TCM, beside = TRUE, col = c("lightblue", "mistyrose", "cyan",  "lavender", "purple"), main = "average alcohol in a month by country", font.main = 4, xlab="average number of drinks", ylab = "country id")



```
